author: hustla187
title: A Fun Set
review: This is a really cool set because everything is just great. The plane, the van, helicopter, and the minifigs really make this set cool and a standard above normal town sets. This is a great set and must be rereleased.

author: Gamer_2k4
title: Not your typical town set
review:
Overall Rating: 4

Ever since I saw the box image for this set, I wanted it.  There was something so different about it: a part of the Lego world you wouldn't expect to see.  In this world of police, fire, trains, airports, and quaint town life, suddenly you have what looks to be a top-secret, private, almost mercenary-like organization for running money undercover over land in in the air.  And now that I own the set, it certainly delivers, with secret compartments and slick color schemes.  It's a lot of fun.

Building Experience: 3

There's nothing particularly special about the building of this set.  The truck is a truck, the helicopter is a helicopter, and the plane is a plane.  Still, there's nothing wrong with it either.

Parts: 4

One of my favorite aspects of this set is the color scheme.  The blacks, yellows, and reds are uncommon in the Town setting (at least for these types of models), and the addition of two radios, six suitcases, and a bunch of coins makes for a nifty set.

Playability: 4

The playability is where this set really shines.  Both the helicopter and the plane have secret compartments for the luggage (though the helicopter's is just a spot behind the pilot's seat), and with the three minifigures and the truck, there are no shortage of possibilities for covert transportation missions (or legitimate ones, if you prefer).

Value for Money: 4

I bought this set on eBay for 15 dollars, which I understand to be a great bargain.  Given the pieces you get and the scope of the possibilities with the set, I think it's a great value for the money.
